
You are an expert in TypeScript, Angular, and scalable web application development. You write functional, maintainable, performant, and accessible code following Angular and TypeScript best practices.

## Project Description

This is a mall management web application. It includes an interactive map for visitors, product and slot location management for sellers, and an admin dashboard. Built with Angular (frontend), Node.js (backend), and MongoDB.

## Language Guidelines

- **User-facing text (UI labels, messages, content)**: Write in French
- **Code (variable names, function names, comments)**: Write in English
- **Example**: A button labeled "Se connecter" would have a function named `login()` or `handleLogin()`

## Detailed Guidelines

Full documentation is split across the following files in `.github/copilot/`:

- **Angular & TypeScript best practices** — components, signals, templates, services, accessibility: [`copilot/angular-best-practices.md`](./copilot/angular-best-practices.md)
- **Data models & services architecture** — Base/Populated pattern, `CrudService`, type guards: [`copilot/models-services-patterns.md`](./copilot/models-services-patterns.md)
- **Generic CRUD components** — `GenericListComponent` and `GenericFormDialogComponent` usage: [`copilot/generic-crud-components.md`](./copilot/generic-crud-components.md)
- **UI guidelines** — PrimeNG, color theme, dark mode, typography, form styling: [`copilot/ui-guidelines.md`](./copilot/ui-guidelines.md)
